itemDescription: British plant hunter, nursery owner and botanist

wikipedia_page.main: William Bull (1828-1902) was an English botanist, nurseryman and plant collector. He was born in Winchester and in 1861 purchased the nursery of John Weeks and Company in King's Road, Chelsea. He introduced into cultivation, plants from other countries, including orchids from Colombia and Liberia.

response: The Lilium tigrinum flore pleno, the double-flowered variety, had been exported out of Japan by William Bull since 1869.
* William Bull (governor) (1638–1755), landowner and politician in the Province of South Carolina
* William Bull II (1710–1791), lieutenant governor of the Province of South Carolina
* William Bull (landowner) (1867–1956), founder of Bilbul, a small town in New South Wales, Australia
* Sir William Bull, 1st Baronet (1863–1931), British solicitor and politician
